story.text: [[Microsoft Scripting Tools]] refer to [[Scripting Language]]s for use in application development in [[Microsoft Windows]], including but not limited to [[Web Scripting]].
All? of the [[Microsoft Corporation]] tools come under the branding of [[Active Xscripting]], with the best well known one being [[Vb Script]]. See also [[Windows Scripting Host]]
Has [[Microsoft Dot Net]] got an officially endorsed [[Scripting Language]]?
[[Java Script]] is the most widely used "third party" [[Scripting Language]].

Due to the market presence of MS, lots of srcipting tool providers from other environments often provide direct port of their application to [[Microsoft Windows]] (e.g. see [https://sourceforge.net/projects/pywin32/ sourceforge.net] ).
Some scripting tools from the Unix world can be used after a suitable emulator is installed (e.g. [[Cgy Win]]). And with Unix comes lots of [[Scripting Language]] variants.
